{    "question": {        "content": "

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "## BlockOut

Use the arrow keys to bounce the projectile off of your paddle to destroy all the blocks on the screen!

![Game view in simulator](/static/lessons/block-out/working-game.gif)

## Learning Objectives

Learn the basics to a basic bouncing projectile game!

* The concept of sprite
* How to spawn multiple sprites
* Sprite projectile interactions
* Setting and moving a "player" 
* Setting a score increment
* Semi-random movement

## Lesson Sections

* [Part One: Creating the Sprites](#part-one-creating-the-sprites)
* [Part Two: Creating the Blocks](#part-two-creating-the-blocks)
* [Part Three: Finishing the Setup](#part-three-finishing-the-setup)
* [Part Four: Ball and Paddle Interactions](#part-four-ball-and-paddle-interactions)
* [Part Five: Directional Bouncing](#part-five-directional-bouncing)
* [Part Six: Creating Block Collisions](#part-six-creating-block-collisions)
* [Part Seven: Ending the Game](#part-seven-ending-the-game)

",                    "background": "#fff",                    "blockTitle": "",                    "expandable": false,                    "expanded": false,                    "widgets": {}                },                "version": {                    "major": 0,                    "minor": 0                }            }        }    },    "answerArea": {        "type": "multiple",        "options": {},        "calculator": false    },    "itemDataVersion": {        "major": 0,        "minor": 1    },    "hints": []}

subject: 電腦科學
question:
{    "question": {        "content": "

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# One: Creating the Sprites

Go to the [MakeCode Arcade](@homeurl@) editor and select **New Project** to create a new game.  

Once the editor loads, you will see a green $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$ block already in the editor Workspace.

At first, we want to create the main player of the game which in our case will be a paddle. Drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite to sprite of kind player}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$ block. Then click on $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{mySprite}}\\$ and select rename variable. Name your variable to paddle. Then in the image editor, click on the 16x16 block until it reads 32x32. Draw a purple line near the bottom of the image.

![Switching sizes](/static/lessons/block-out/32x32Blockout.gif)

Next, drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite position to x y}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ and put it into the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$ block. Set the **x** value to **79** and the **y** value to **100**. Again, from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$, drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite stay in screen}}\\$ into the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$. Change mySprite to paddle and then switch the toggle from **OFF** to **ON**. Now in $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#d54322",mathbackground="#d54322"]{\color{white}{Controller}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#d54322",mathbackground="#d54322"]{\color{white}{move mySprite with buttons}}\\$ and drag it into $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$. Also, change mySprite to paddle. Click the **(+)** sign and set the **vx** value to **100** and **vy** value to **0**.  

![Player moving on the screen](/static/lessons/block-out/moving-player.gif)

Next, we will make the projectile that will bounce against the paddle, walls, and blocks. Go into $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ and grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set projectile to projectile from mySprite}}\\$ and then place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="black",mathbackground="black"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$. Click on the image editor and draw a ball. Change mySprite to paddle and set **vx** to **50** and **vy** to **-55**. Go to $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite stay in screen}}\\$, and drag it into the workspace. Then set the mySprite to projectile and then change the stay in screen to destroy on wall. Keep the toggle set to **OFF**. Right click on the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set projectile destroy on wall off}}\\$ and duplicate the block. Drag it into $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$. Change destroy on wall to bounce on wall and switch the toggle to **ON**.

[[☃ iframe 1]]

[[☃ iframe 2]]

Congratulations! You have now created the main sprites for the game.

",                    "background": "#fff",                    "blockTitle": "",                    "expandable": false,                    "expanded": false,                    "widgets": {"iframe 2": {                                    "type": "iframe",                                    "graded": true,                                    "options": {                                        "url": "https://jerry914.github.io/arcade-test/block-out/1.html",                                        "settings": [                                            {                                                "name": "",                                                "value": ""                                            }                                        ],                                        "width": 560,                                        "height": 320                                    },                                    "version": {                                        "major": 0,                                        "minor": 0                                    }                                }}                },                "version": {                    "major": 0,                    "minor": 0                }            }        }    },    "answerArea": {        "type": "multiple",        "options": {},        "calculator": false    },    "itemDataVersion": {        "major": 0,        "minor": 1    },    "hints": []}

{    "question": {        "content": "

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# Two: Creating the Blocks

In this part of the lesson we are going to create the blocks. Go into $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{Loops}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{for index from 0 to}}\\$, and drag it into the workspace. Change the field input to **9**. Duplicate the same block and place it inside the first loop. Now change the field input from **9** to **2**. Go into $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ and create a new variable called index2.  Next drag out the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{index2}}\\$ and place it in the input of the second $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{for loop}}\\$. 

### Creating an Offset

![Block Offset](/static/lessons/block-out/offset.png)

In $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ drag out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set var to}}\\$ and place it in the second $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{for}}\\$ loop. Select the drop down and rename the variable to **x**. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{_ X _}}\\$ block and pull it into the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set x to}}\\$ block. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ drag out an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{index}}\\$ block and drag it into the first field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{_ X _}}\\$ block. Set the second field to **18**. 

Now, from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$, grab an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then}}\\$ statement and drag it into the second loop. Drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 = 0}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ and place it inside the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then}}\\$ statement. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$ pull out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{remainder of _ / _}}\\$ block and move it into the first field of the equal statement. From variables, grab $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{index2}}\\$ block and drag it into the first field of the remainder. Set the second field of the remainder to **2**. Lastly, set the end field of the equal statement to **1**. 

Now we are going to offset the blocks dependent on the row they are spawned in. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set x to}}\\$ and drag it into the if statement. Grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 + 0}}\\$ block from math and drag it into the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set x to}}\\$. Then in the first field place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ and then from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{index}}\\$ block and drag it into the first field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$. Now set the second field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ to **18** and set the second field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 + 0}}\\$ to **8**. 

### ~hint

Your $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{for}}\\$ should look like this.

[[☃ iframe 1]]

[[☃ iframe 2]]

### ~

### Spawning the Blocks

Now in $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{ set x to}}\\$ and place it after the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement. Select the drop down and then click new variable and name it tilePick. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{pick random}}\\$ and set it to be from **0** to **2**.

Get an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{ if then else}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ and drag it in after the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set tilePick to}}\\$. Click the **(+)** symbol on the new $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then else}}\\$. In both of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then else}}\\$ fields, place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 = 0}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$. Then from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$, drag out 2 $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{tilePick}}\\$ blocks and place them in the first field of each of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 = 0}}\\$ blocks. Set the second field of the first part to **0** and the second field of the second part to **1**. 

Then from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite to sprite of kind player}}\\$ block. Select the first drop down and create a new name called tile. Then click player and select add a new kind and name it block. Draw a picture of a block in the sprite editor. Duplicate this block and set it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{else if}}\\$ section and the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{else}}\\$ section. Draw different tiles for each part.

Lastly, from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite position to}}\\$ and drag it in after the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then else if then else}}\\$ block. Click mySprite and select tile. Then drag from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{x}}\\$ block and place it in the x field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite position to}}\\$. In the y field drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 + 0}}\\$ block and place it there. In the first field, drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block there and set the second field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block to **18**. In the first part of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block, put in a a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{index2}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$. In the last field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 + 0}}\\$ block set it to **20**.

[[☃ iframe 3]]

[[☃ iframe 4]]

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# Three: Finishing the Setup

Now on to finish the set up of the game. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#cf6a87",mathbackground="#cf6a87"]{\color{white}{Info}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#cf6a87",mathbackground="#cf6a87"]{\color{white}{set score to 0}}\\$ block and drag it into the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$. Change the **0** to **1**. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b6584",mathbackground="#4b6584"]{\color{white}{Scene}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b6584",mathbackground="#4b6584"]{\color{white}{set background color to}}\\$ and set it to light pink. Lastly, from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set var to}}\\$ and drag it into $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{on start}}\\$. Click the drop down and hit new variable, and make a variable called **direction**, and set its value to **1**.

[[☃ iframe 1]]

[[☃ iframe 2]]

",                    "background": "#fff",                    "blockTitle": "",                    "expandable": false,                    "expanded": false,                    "widgets": {"iframe 2": {                                    "type": "iframe",                                    "graded": true,                                    "options": {                                        "url": "https://jerry914.github.io/arcade-test/block-out/4.html",                                        "settings": [                                            {                                                "name": "",                                                "value": ""                                            }                                        ],                                        "width": 560,                                        "height": 320                                    },                                    "version": {                                        "major": 0,                                        "minor": 0                                    }                                }}                },                "version": {                    "major": 0,                    "minor": 0                }            }        }    },    "answerArea": {        "type": "multiple",        "options": {},        "calculator": false    },    "itemDataVersion": {        "major": 0,        "minor": 1    },    "hints": []}

{    "question": {        "content": "

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# Four: Ball and Paddle Interactions

![Ball and Paddle](/static/lessons/block-out/moving-player.gif)

To create the interaction, go to $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ and grab an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{on sprite of kind player overlaps othersprite of kind player}}\\$ and drag it anywhere in your workspace. Change the first player to projectile and check that the second is set to player. Next, from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite velocity to}}\\$ and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{on sprite of kind player overlaps}}\\$. Drag sprite from the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlaps}}\\$ block and drag it into the mySprite section of the velocity block. 

Back in $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$ block and drag it into the vx field. Drag the sprite out of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlap}}\\$ block and place it over the mySprite in the vx field. Now click the x drop down and select vx (velocity x). 

From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block and place it in the vy section of the velocity block. Set the first field of the block to **-1** and, in $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$ and drag it into the second field. Click the drop down and select vy (velocity y). Drag sprite from the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlap}}\\$ block and place it over the mySprite in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite vy}}\\$.

[[☃ iframe 1]]

[[☃ iframe 2]]

subject: 電腦科學
question:
{    "question": {        "content": "

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# Five: Directional Bouncing

![Directional Bouncing](/static/lessons/block-out/directional-bouncing.gif)

When our ball collides with a block, we want to be able to detect which side the block bounced on. In our implementation, we are going to create a function for this event. To do this, go under Advanced to find the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#1446a0",mathbackground="#1446a0"]{\color{white}{Functions}}\\$ and click Make a Function.... The function editor then pops up. Type in **getPos** where it says **doSomething**. This will mean the position of the ball relative to the block. Click on Sprite in the upper bar. A new **parameter** is now added. Name it to **sprite**. Again, click on Sprite in the upper bar. Another parameter pops up, name it to **otherSprite**.

![Creating Functions](/static/lessons/block-out/creating-functions.gif)

### ~hint

#### The Definition of Parameter

A function can be called anywhere in the code. A function can have parameters of different types. This means that when the function is called, things such as variables can be passed into the function to be modified or edited. 

### ~

From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{ if then else}}\\$ block and place it in the function. Now from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{_ or _}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement. 

From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 < 0}}\\$ block and place it in the first field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{_ or _}}\\$ block. Next, in the first field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 < 0}}\\$ block, place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$. Drag sprite from the function block and place it on the mySprite. In the second field, place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 - 0}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$. Set the second field to **8**. In the first part of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0-0}}\\$ block, place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$. Drag an otherSprite from the function and place it in the mySprite. 

Duplicate the entire block (the one that started as jsut the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 < 0}}\\$) and place it in the second field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{or}}\\$ conditional statement. Change the < sign to a > sign. Then, in the math block, change the - sign to a + sign. In the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement then place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set var to}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$. Click the dropdown and select direction. Then type in **1**. In the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{else}}\\$ statement place a  $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{set var to}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$. Click the dropdown and select direction. Then type in **0**.

Congrats, we have now made a function!

{    "question": {        "content": "

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# Six: Creating Block Collisions

![Bouncing](/static/lessons/block-out/directional-bouncing.gif)

In our game, when the player collides with a block, the ball should bounce, the block should be destroyed, and the score should increment. 

From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{on sprite of kind player overlaps}}\\$ and place it in the workspace. Change the first kind from player to projectile. Then for the second kind, change it from kind player to kind block. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#cf6a87",mathbackground="#cf6a87"]{\color{white}{Info}}\\$ drag out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#cf6a87",mathbackground="#cf6a87"]{\color{white}{change score by 1}}\\$ and place it in the new $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlap}}\\$ block. Then in $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#1446a0",mathbackground="#1446a0"]{\color{white}{Functions}}\\$, grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#1446a0",mathbackground="#1446a0"]{\color{white}{call getPos mySprite mySprite}}\\$ and place it after the score block. 

Now grab an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then else}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ and place it after the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#1446a0",mathbackground="#1446a0"]{\color{white}{call getPos}}\\$. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ grab a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 = 0}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement. Set the second **0** to **1**. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{Variables}}\\$ drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#ec3b59",mathbackground="#ec3b59"]{\color{white}{direction}}\\$ and place it in the spot for the first **0**. 

In the first part of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement, place a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite velocity to}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$. Drag a sprite from the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlaps}}\\$ block and place it over the mySprite. In the vx field, drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$. In the first field of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block type in **-1** and in the second field, drag in a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$. Drag a sprite from the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{}}\\$ block and place it over the mySprite. Then select the drop down and change it to vx (velocity x). In the vy section, drag in a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{0 x 0}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{Math}}\\$ and set the first field to **-1**. Pull in a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$. Drag a sprite from the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlaps}}\\$ block and place it over the mySprite. Then select the drop down and change it to vy (velocity y).

Duplicate the entire $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{set mySprite velocity to}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{else}}\\$ statement. Drag out the vx and vy fields and switch them. In the first field that corresponds to vx, set the drop down to vx (velocity x). In the second field that corresponds to vy, and inside the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#a55eea",mathbackground="#a55eea"]{\color{white}{-1x(sprite)vx velocity x}}\\$, change the drop down to vy (velocity y). 

Lastly, outside of the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement, drag a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{destroy mySprite}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$. Drag an otherSprite from the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{overlaps}}\\$ block and place it over the mySprite.

[[☃ iframe 1]]

[[☃ iframe 2]]

[[☃ article-block 1]]",        "images": {},        "widgets": {            "article-block 1": {                "type": "article-block",                "graded": false,                "options": {                    "articleBlock": "# Seven: Ending the Game

From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{Loops}}\\$ drag out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{forever block}}\\$ and place it anywhere in the workspace. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ drag out an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{forever}}\\$ loop. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ drag out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 > 0}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement. Set the second field to **119**. Then from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{Sprites}}\\$ drag out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#4b7bec",mathbackground="#4b7bec"]{\color{white}{mySprite x}}\\$ and place it in the first field. Set the mySprite to projectile and the x to bottom. Inside the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement drag in a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#8854d0",mathbackground="#8854d0"]{\color{white}{game over lose}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#8854d0",mathbackground="#8854d0"]{\color{white}{Game}}\\$. Click the **(+)** symbol and set the effect to slash. 

Then from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$, drag out an $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if then}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#20bf6b",mathbackground="#20bf6b"]{\color{white}{forever}}\\$ loop. From $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{Logic}}\\$ drag out a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{0 = 0}}\\$ block and place it in the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement. Set the second field to **30**. For the first field, drag in $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#cf6a87",mathbackground="#cf6a87"]{\color{white}{score}}\\$ from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#cf6a87",mathbackground="#cf6a87"]{\color{white}{Info}}\\$. Inside the $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#45aaf2",mathbackground="#45aaf2"]{\color{white}{if}}\\$ statement drag in a $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#8854d0",mathbackground="#8854d0"]{\color{white}{game over lose}}\\$ block from $\require{enclose}\enclose{box}[mathcolor="#8854d0",mathbackground="#8854d0"]{\color{white}{Game}}\\$. Switch the toggle to **WIN** and then click the **(+)** symbol set the effect to brighten. 

[[☃ iframe 1]]

[[☃ iframe 2]]

Now we have a fully functioning game!

## Final Game
